poem:
The Seed of Hope  
  
In Walthamstow, where dreams are small,  
doorways open in concrete walls.  
A couple, rooted, sees a chance—  
a slice of space in life's vast dance.  
No seeds to sow, yet earth will turn,  
and hearts, like homes, in silence yearn.  
The cage, though tight, gives room to grow,  
where tiny hopes in shadows glow.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Meet the young families stuck in their starter homes thanks to the UK housing crisis | Kirsty Major When Ronan and his wife lived as property guardians in Walthamstow, east London, owning a place of their own seemed out of their reach. But in 2018, an opportunity presented itself: a development offering compact one-bedroom flats at a discounted price to people living in the local community. The couple had no plans to start a family". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
